1.title: Cinta Notes
1.features: small, portable; quick save, search; tags
1.drawbacks: only notes, windows style, overloaded interface, mess with database backups

2.title: ShoveBox
2.features: capturing texts, URLs and other pieces of information; single view for all collected

3.title: Makagiga
3.features: todo-list, notes, calendar, sticky widgets; RSS, complex UI
3.drawbacks: overloaded UI, standard UI components, focused features, but not focused from the user's point of view

4.title: Yast
4.features: task time tracking; projects, groups; time bar, collaboration, focused view

5.title: GTG-Fritalk
5.features: two level task lists, single task review screen, tags; plugins; GNOME
5.drawbacks: overloaded UI, fixed system, standard UI

6.title: Tranglos Keynote
6.features: trees of items, old Windows style
6.drawbacks: Windows only, old school UI, too many non-profit menu items

7.title: Toodledo
7.features: tasks table, notes, collaboration; tags, priorities; single review screen
7.drawbacks: all in one screen, standard task manager UI and functions

8.title: Remember The Milk
8.features: one line add(^, #), automatic lists, reminders
8.drawbacks: overloaded interface, only task tracking, no local copy

9.title: Chandler
9.features: one line add, now/next/done, calendar, reminders; integrations
9.drawbacks: overloaded interface; task tracking in a heart, over-integration, single review screen for all, no local copy

10.title: DoIt App
10.features: one line add(^,#), many task attributes, reminders, filters, calendar; single review screen; integrations

11.title: CulturedCode Things
11.features: single review screen; inplace edit; d'n'd; now/next/done; tags, filters; cloud sync

12.title: MyLifeOrganized
12.features: task tree, contexts, dependencies, time; cloud sync
12.drawbacks: too complex, overloaded interface; trees with small elements

13.title: Planary
13.features: one line add (+category); now/next/done; d`n`d; integration
13.drawbacks: page space is used inefficiently, small panels for content, no time frames, tasks only, no local copy

14.title: Smthngs
14.features: beauty in grey; now/next/done; tags, reminders, filtering, search; GEO location
14.drawbacks: tricky interface (~buggy), right side menu/filter/search, page space is used inefficiently, tasks only, no local copy

15.title: TreeIt
15.drawbacks: overloaded interface, small buttons, tasks only, only one perspective for data

16.title: ThinkingRock
16.features: GTD-oriented, full workflow; tabs, task list, single review screen

17.title: Taskwarrior
17.features: command-line interface; tasks, priorities, projects; management by IDs; filtering

18.title: CheckVist
18.features: notes, tasks, hierarchical lists, collaboration, email notifications
18.drawbacks: tasks only, overloaded interface, email registration, too many actions to achieve result

19.title: TodoCamp
19.features: TODO-oriented, short tasks wrapped in lists

20.title: Wunderlist
20.platforms: Web, iPhone, iPad, Win, Linux, Mac
20.features: high quality design; simple tasks review screen; sorting, filtering; Cloud sync
20.drawbacks: tasks only, too simple for lists creation

21.title: TODOist
21.features: hierarchical tasks table, filtered; projects; one line add; due-dates (no calendar) with 'today' key word
21.drawbacks: tasks only, too many components / steps to achieve results; standard components

22.title: Tudumo
22.features: task lists, tags, filters; Windows style
22.drawbacks: too simple tasks workflows, Windows only, old interface

23.title: Vitalist
23.features: actions, projects, contexts; full GTD; complex task list

24.title: Compendium
24.features: schemes and mind maps of any type and complexity
24.drawbacks: too complicated and powerful, only desktop, no backups

26.title: Moredays
26.features: events/notes/tasks/contacts; tasty; integration with google services
26.drawbacks: too many pictures; beauty over effectiveness

27.title: Leader Task
27.features: all in one screen, contacts, task list, e-mail, filters
27.drawbacks: overloaded interface, more like corporate tool, all-in-one and no focus

28.title: Diigo
28.features: captures texts, bookmarks; research/share/collaborate; web reports about captured; tags, comments, notifications, following, user groups
28.drawbacks: overloaded add function, pure information flow oriented (no calendars or tasks)

29.title: EffyTools
29.features: small and simple, one line add, 5 focused services, local copy
29.drawbacks: Mess with data backups; no archived items

30.title: 42tasks
30.features: one line add, projects, calendar, contacts, collaboration
30.drawbacks: mostly useful for collaboration, no local copy

31.title: Get It Done
31.features: GTD-oriented; contacts, groups, projects, collaboration, calendar; Cloud sync
31.drawbacks: overloaded UI, GTD system only, standard UI

32.title: VQS Personal Task Manager
32.features: tasks table, projects tree, calendar, notes, attachments, graphs

33.title: GanttProject
33.features: project scheduling and management, Gant diagrams

34.title: Orbisoft Task Manager
34.drawbacks: overloaded interface, windows only, too many tables, focused on projects'n'tables

35.title: Taskfreak
35.features: server solution, open source project management application

45.title: Thinkery
45.features: Capturing notes, URLs; extra-info provided by service; search, tags

46.title: WorkFlowy
46.features: One list with powerful navigation and folding fot making lists, easy for typing and navigation

48.title: Do It (Tomorrow)
48.features: Today-and-Tomorrow view, easy and sexy look and feel, simple task management

49.title: Goal Stacker
49.features: Wisely time-bound tasks, lists, reminders, time-tracking; sharing

52.title: Midnight Inbox
52.features: Full GTD, automatic features; special workflow

53.title: Springpad
53.features: Capturing pictures, texts, sound; recongnition, search; sync; collaboration

54.title: Evernote
54.features: Capturing pictures and texts; recongnition, search; sync

55.title: Zoho suite
55.features: A lot of small services of any kind, working together

56.title: TaskPaper
56.features: Single list paper view, formatting means type; sync

57.title: OmniFocus
57.features: Full GTD; sync; pretty user interface

60.title: Nirvanahq
60.features: Capture texts; full GTD; projects; lists, filtering, search, exporting

67.title: SimpleNote
67.features: Easy notes management; sharing and publishing; tags; sync

68.title: Notational Velocity (Alt+)
68.features: Keyboard-featured note taking app; fast add, search, filtering; content is compressed and encrypted

70.title: Trello
70.features: ticket cards and boards(kanban), check lists, attachments; collaboration

72.title: Taskpaper+
72.features: task lists and trees, notes, tags; wiki-syntax; local, remote server

73.title: CalenGoo
73.features: calendar with views, agenda; gmail sync

74.title: Lifetick
74.features: goals-oriented planning, journaling; status widgets, reports; collaboration

75.title: Time Optimizer
75.features: goals-oriented planning, calendar views, gantts; projections

83.title: Cacoo
83.features: Easy and powerful diagram drawing; history, export; team collaboration, share, real-time, chat

85.title: Do.com
85.features: Task list, projects, notes, contacts, chat, groups, templates, reminders, files, calendar; integrations

113.title: myTinyTodo
113.features: Lists, notes, tags, due dates, priorities, search, smart syntax.
